content.description: This climb is quite wonderful! The pressure is on from the beginning as you climb up and right through difficult but awesome movement.  The final crux is pulling up & over the steep roof.  Anywhere else in Arkansas and this would certainly be an easy 11!
content.location: The arete to the right of Solitaire

content.description: Powerful, steep, & thoughtful climbing through the first 3 bolts.  Atypical from the classic vertical Magazine routes. Stick clip the 1st bolt.  Eventually merges with Velvet Elvis.Rebolted in winter 2021.
content.location: Down the hill from the Solitaire corner to the right of Velvet Elvis.  This route starts below the right corner of a roof feature.

content.description: Climb the slightly overhanging dihedral with a few good rests to roof/ledge and traverse right on ledge to belay ledge

climbs.name: Second Rodeo
climbs.fa: Equipped by: Chase Webb FA: Judith Brown

content.description: Start up the first third of Solitaire then make your way left to a line of bolts leading to the arete. Although the arete is short lived, the rock and powerful arete climbing make it memorable.
content.protection: #3 and smaller for first part of Solitaire (extension recommended before moving to the bolts). 3 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Head down the trail, climber's right until you reach the obvious corner crack of Solitaire. Start the same as Solitaire and make your way left to the arete.

content.description: Originally an 11c but likely more difficult due to a broken hold at the low roof.
content.location: Rightmost route on the BOB wall

content.description: Three hard sections as expected on the BOB wall.
content.location: Leftmost route on the BOB wall.

content.description: Hardest route at mag currently. Contains a series of roofs requiring powerful moves. Crux hits above the 3rd bolt.
content.location: Starts under the bulging face around the corner from the BOB wall & Solitaire corner.

content.description: A true gem for Arkansas - this route was established by Todd Skinner  & guidebook author Tim Toula. This is a true 12a if you have some reach, otherwise this is much more difficult.

One of the steeper face climbs at Mount Mag! Big moves on good holds make this an atypical route for the area. A tricky start leads you to a steepening wall on nice, clean rock with interesting holds. Once on the ledge the climbing eases off and so does the quality of the route. The second half is dirty and doesn't really have a defined line. Pull down, not out on the orange flake. Probably better only to use the left side of it, to extend this routes lifetime.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Shares anchors with "French Connection" and "Viva Las Vegas."
content.location: Just left and around the corner from Viva Las Vegas. Look for the steeper route with orange and gray rock.

content.description: Bring you edging shoes! This route has some classic Magazine technical climbing. This route is fairly sustained throughout the bolted section, however, the technical crux is near the top. At the ledge plug a #3 BD cam and finish it out to the anchors. The movement on this route is difficult and thought provoking, the hard to read beta could make or break the send.
content.protection: 4 draws and a #3 Camalot. Two bolt anchor.
content.location: Middle water streak of the "Black on Blonde" wall.

content.description: To the right of the Breakfast Wall.
